::: {.notes}
In the 1970s, the Viking missions were the first to land on Mars.
Goal: Is there life on Mars?

Experiments showed positive results, but the results were inconclusive and were not repeated due to budget constraints.
:::

## The Early Days of Mars Exploration {.smaller transition="fade-in slide-out"}
- 1990s: Philosophical shift
	- *"Did Mars ever have the conditions to support life as we know it?"*

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
- August 2012: Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) mission
	- Curiosity rover

![](static/introduction/msl.jpg){height=50% width=50% fig-align="center"}
:::


::: {.notes}
1990s: Philosophical shift in the scientific community.
The focus shifted from "Is there life on Mars?" to "Did Mars ever have the conditions to support life as we know it?"

August 2012: The Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) mission lands the Curiosity rover on Mars.
:::
